title: Potting up Tomato Seedlings! ALL 540 of Them!

subtasks: Ensure potting soil is moist before transplanting.
Use fingers to poke holes in each cell of the transplant tray.
Carefully pinch the seedling from the base and remove from the original plug.
Plant seedlings deep, burying stems up to the first set of true leaves.
Fill in around seedlings with moist soil, avoiding compaction.
Water transplants thoroughly immediately after planting.
Mark different tomato varieties in their respective cells.
Monitor for transplant shock and adjust watering as needed.
Delay fertilization until the plants have recovered and developed new roots.
Gradually introduce seedlings to outdoor conditions over a week or two.
Check for frost protection and delay planting if necessary.
Prepare plants for outdoor planting by acclimating them to sunlight and wind.
Monitor nutritional needs as plants grow, adjusting feeding schedule when appropriate.
Water plants thoroughly to settle soil and reduce air pockets.
Maintain even moisture levels avoiding extremes of dryness or overwatering.
Remove damaged or wilted leaves to promote healthier growth.
